description: Two Kids Brewing Company is San Diego's newest Nanobrewery! Now open, we're serving the finest in tasty and unusual ales, sans snobby attitude.

name: 350 Brewing Company
description:
The 350 Brewing Company has spawned from the ashes of our failed Collegiate careers at Northern Illinois University. Let me explain. 350 Augusta Ave. was our address in Dekalb, IL. At the time, your founders Todd and Erik spent more time on projects like way below average punk rock bands in the attic, and a Hardcore Wrestling Federation called WCVF (this took place in our kitchen), instead of focusing on classes like Humanities 227 in DuSable Hall. I mean, have you ever choke slammed one of your best friends into an oven pre-heated to "550 degrees"? Well i have, and that was just a random Wednesday night. This raw energy (stupidity) and creativity is what eventually drew us to the Craft Beer scene. That’s what craft beer is…a creative and fresh twist on a beverage that has been mass produced and shoved down our throats for much too long (carefully stepping down from soapbox). Why not name our Brewery after the point in our life when we were most creative? Well…..we did. It was during these times we were also introduced to good, quality beer.

Once NIU had enough of our shenanigans, Erik went on to continue his education while I submerged myself into the cesspool known as corporate America. I feel dirty just talking about it. Over the last decade, my soul has been slowly rotting and exiting my body so there was a need for this creative juice to be squeezed once again. Since wrestling and punk rock was now out of the question, brewing beer quickly became that much needed release from the Groundhog Day that had become the norm for us. Erik like most homebrewers started out brewing with extract several years ago and quickly rose to the challenge of all-grain batches. Erik, the 350 Head brewer, has been very successful when entering brewing competitions walking away with multiple awards for his Porter and Patersbier. Myself on the other hand have had a love for flavorful craft beer for many moons, and once I learned of Erik’s brewing expertise years ago, I too became emerged in this brewing lifestyle. It was a match made in heaven. Erik brewed awesome beer, and I was awesome at drinking and sharing that beer!!! 

From that point on things just sort of clicked and for the last 2 years Erik and I have been researching and concocting this master plan of opening a brewery. The time has come. We want all of you to enjoy this journey with us. Tinley Park has always been our #1 choice for the 350 Brewing Company. Downtown Tinley Park embodies the spirit of 350. With great electricity in the downtown area, coupled with an amazing artistic feel, will definitely pair well with our vision of always making sure a visit to our brewery is an interesting experience. We feel Tinley Park is ready for a neighborhood brewery. It really was an easy decision based on Tinley Park’s sense of community and passion for supporting local products.

We are looking forward to joining the family of incredible Illinois Brewers. We should all thank our lucky stars that we live in a state with such high quality Breweries.

name: 3Cross Brewing Company
description: A small brewery and taproom in Worcester, Massachusetts.

name: 51 North Brewing Company
description: Attention Beer Lovers, what you've been hearing is true! Lake Orion is about to have its very own microbrewery – 51 North Brewing Company. We will be located at 51 North Broadway, hence the name. Mary and Don Gindhart lead a small group of beer-loving, business-minded individuals that share one purpose – to create a microbrewery like no other. We will have an amazing lineup of hand-crafted beers, wines and meads, all made in-house. Along with this diverse group of drink selections, we will offer unique food pairings to complement these libations and provide high-quality entertainment and service. All these ingredients add up to a destination perfect for individuals, couples, families and friends.

name: 612Brew
description: In the heart of the Northeast Minneapolis Arts and Brewery District, 612Brew calls Central and Broadway home. 612Brew produces small-batch beers to satisfy both the weekend beer drinker and the craft beer drinker with a discerning palate. Enjoy the local brewing culture while sipping a pint in our taproom, then look upon our mirror-polished tanks or sit in the courtyard amphitheater and rain garden. Come on, Minnesota. I'm Thirsty Already.

name: 7th Settlement Brewery
description: A Community Supported Brewery (CSB) in Dover, NH. Specializing in high quality, hand crafted American and English style Ales.  Enjoy a paring of our great beers with our amazing locally sourced progressive American pub fair!

name: 903 Brewers
description:
903 Brewers was founded on a simple idea; make great beer for a great community. With that idea in mind Jeremy and Natalie Roberts began building the foundation for 903 Brewers back in 2011.
 
Jeremy Roberts is not only the founder but also the head brewer. He spent years perfecting his recipes and letting the community decide what beers they wanted from their local brewery. He fearlessly concocted hundreds of different beers to see what new flavors he might come up with. Not all were a hit, but that is how you find a gem. Do you have an idea for a beer you’d like to try? Let him know, he just might try it out.
 
903 Brewers officially opened its doors in June of 2013 and introduced to the world The Chosen One Coconut Ale and Roo’s Red Ale. Since that time they have released many new and exciting beers. Starting fall of 2014 you will be able to find their beers in 22oz bombers.

name: Absolution Brewing Company
description:
As the world grows in its understanding of what beer can and should be, no longer imprisoned by the tasteless, unfilling beers of the recent past, it craves beer made with sincere passion and an unwavering boldness of flavor. And to provide that beer is our mission.

Focusing on Old World styles and New World hops, we are creating a fusion of flavors and aromas to titillate the palate and arouse the olfactory. British, Belgian, and German styles will dominate our taps, while sours will be fermenting and aging from early on.

Absolution Brewing Company is a labor of love for three friends that have a passion for delicious craft beer. Nigel is an English gent that found his way to the West Coast more than two decades ago. Steve is a local boy, born and raised in the South Bay Los Angeles area with deep ties throughout the community. Wes is from the swamps of Louisiana and discovered Southern California via the Navy. Individually, we are but mere beer drinkers in love with the craft. Together, we are a team dedicated to fulfilling our dreams to bring the best beers to the world that others may feel the passion on their palates.

name: Appalachian Mountain Brewery
description:
The Appalachian Mountain Brewery (AMB) is a craft brewery located in the heart of North Carolina’s High Country. Home of the Appalachian State Mountaineers, Boone has countless outdoor activities at your fingertips: rock climbing, hiking, biking, kayaking, skiing, snowboarding, and more! AMB supplies fresh, flavorful beer to the High Country, while maintaining a strong emphasis on both sustainable values and the local community.

Although our craft is beer, AMB is much more than a brewery. Our founding principles go well beyond the pint glass and focus on ideals that strive to empower individuals, support local enterprise, and give back to the greater Appalachian region.  This can best be summarized in our motto:  ”Act Local. Drink Local.”

We will set a new precedent within the brewing industry through an intimate knowledge of the science behind sustainability and a strong desire to improve the current status quo in the field.  We will utilize photovoltaic solar panels, native rain gardens and wetlands, rain water harvesting, and local farm collaboration. Through these efforts AMB will make the highest quality beer while maintaining the highest quality of respect for not only the local community but also the planet at large.

Act Local. Drink Local.

name: Apple Blossom Brewing Company
description:
Evan McDonald, Ching Mong, Al Shaffer, Daniel Smith, Sammie Stephenson, and Joe Utsch would like to announce the start of construction of The Apple Blossom Brewing Company!

Named after the Arkansas state flower, the 8,500 square foot, 250 seat brewpub will be a celebration of all things local, from the food to the ingredients in the beer.
The 10 barrel brewing system will be the birthplace of many varied styles and flavors, with an eye to the emerging trends coming from the coasts and Colorado. Fayetteville can expect the traditional favorites, such as pale ales and ESB's, but should also be ready for tantilising and challenging specials and seasonals. 

The kitchen will be headed by Joe Utsch, who wowed Fayetteville years ago with his menu at Joe's Bistro. Soups, salads, sandwiches, and focaccia pizzas will be flagship menu items, all featuring either ABBC beer as an ingredient or as a recommended pairing. Weekends and evening will be graced with exciting and delicious specials, dreamed up in the minds of our chefs and made with the finest and freshest that can be found locally.

name: Appleton Beer Factory
description:
From the self-performed renovation to the custom-fabricated brew train, Appleton Beer Factory was built to immerse patrons in beer culture & display the brewing process. We’re proud of our beer & want you to witness its journey from tun to tongue.

We have an obvious and delicious priority – beer. Our goal is to put top-notch brew in your glass while putting you in a friendly and fun atmosphere. Appleton Beer Factory beers are crafted to deliver what is so often missing from many beers on the market today – balance. This balance was struck from passionate experimentation by knowledgeable brewers who have focused on respecting the ingredients they use and the people they serve.

name: Arizona Wilderness Brewing Company
description:
For years we've dreamed of bringing together our two loves: The beautiful and diverse state of Arizona together with hand crafted, artisanal ales. While backpacking the wondrous depths of Arizona we forged ideas that would one day become Arizona Wilderness Brewing Co. Well, here we are! We will continue our endeavor into the remote beauties of both the Arizona Wilderness and Craft Beer.

Our belief is that beer is more than a beverage to guzzle on Sundays, just another beverage at the party, or cheap yellow fizzy stuff dad drank while wearing his dirty flannel shirts. Beer is culture and we have a true PASSION for this amazing beverage! Check out our food menu, as it was created to pair quite nicely with our fine ales. C’mon in and see what we are up to next!

name: Ashton Brewing Company
description: We are a new Ottawa Brewery with 35 years plus Publican experience. Family run, Friend enjoyed. The Ashton Brewing Company.

name: Bad Martha Beer
description:
At Bad Martha, we believe in three things: great beer, getting bad and doing good. Every sip of our premium craft beer is a reminder that there’s a paradise out there where you can kick off your boat shoes, let your hair down and leave it all behind. That paradise is Martha’s Vineyard. Don’t hold back. Don’t bring your off-island worries. Don’t be too good. Drink it all in.

And while there’s a bit of bad in every drop of beer we brew, there’s also a whole lot of good that comes with every bottle we sell. That’s because Bad Martha is built on a simple idea – community first. We bring this idea to life by donating the first portion of profits to a local hunger relief charity. What’s left goes back into brewing more delicious Bad Martha.

We’re proud of our beer. We’re even prouder of the island that inspired it. We hope you enjoy both as much as we do.

name: Beast Brewing Company
description: Beast Brewing offers a unique line of craft beer focusing on robust flavors for the adventurous palate. We are conveniently located on Highway 92 in the San Jose section of Bisbee, just five minutes from downtown. Our facility offers Stunning views of the Mule Mountains in the USA to the north & the San Jose Mountains in Mexico to the south, indoor & outdoor seating, ample parking and entertainment. We are minutes from internationally renowned birding spot – the San Pedro Riparian, as well as many of Arizona’s beautiful state and national parks, including Coronado National Memorial & Forest for hiking, biking, caving, picnicking, and the like. In addition to Beast Brewing’s adventurous beer offerings, we are Proudly continuing a Bisbee tradition, we brew Electric Beer.  Electric Brewing dates back to 1988, making it Arizona’s first microbrewery.  Electric Beer provides a high-quality approachable line of products. Beast Brewing Company strives to reduce our carbon footprint by incorporating locally sourced ingredients into our products when possible, utilizing refurbished equipment, capturing gray water and donating spent grain to farmers. Stop in to Arizona’s first & wildest craft brewery for a cold, refreshing beverage after an active and sunny day in Arizona. Cheers! - See more at: http://beastbrewingcompany.com/#sthash.NabirAAL.dpuf

name: Beech Mountain Brewing Co.
description:
The newest craft brewery in Western North Carolina has opened in the Alpine Village at Beech Mountain Resort. Beech Mountain Brewing Co. has the capacity to brew up to 100 gallons per day and will be open year round to serve skiers, snowboarders, mountain bikers and other resort visitors.
The brewery features three distinct ales created on-site, with consulting from award-winning brewer Will Young of Blind Squirrel in nearby Plumtree. Heading the list of beers is the 5506 Pale Ale, followed by the Liberty and Yard Sale Ales. Patrons may purchase these high-quality craft beers by the pint or the growler. Flight tastings are also available, along with brewery tours, which include a pint and a keepsake glass.

"The brewery is yet another amenity added to the resort as part of our effort to become a year-round destination,” said Ryan Costin, general manager. “With the growing popularity of craft beer in North Carolina, we believe our customers will enjoy the experience."

name: Beer Army Combat Brewery
description: The Beer Army Combat Brewery is a micro brewery located in Trenton, North Carolina. The brewery opened on April 19th, 2013 in the small town of 287 people.  The brewery maintains a tap room called the "Bunker" where patrons can come sit and drink inside the brewery.  Head Brewer Jeff Brungard retired from the Marine Corps in late 2012.  Owner Dustin Canestorp is currently enlisted as a Major.

name: Beerded Brothers Brewing
description:
Beerded Brothers Brewing Company is started by two step-brothers, Gabriel Pedersen and Max Scudder.

Beerded Brothers Brewing is a 1BBL nanobrewery located in a newly built shop in East Vancouver. Utilizing a mire 540 sq. ft., Beerded Brothers might compete for the smallest nanobrewery in Vancouver, and maybe the country!

name: Benson Brewery
description:
Cradled in the heart of Benson on Omaha’s north side - you will find Benson Brewery, a cozy neighborhood brew-pub welcoming all who look for friendly company, good conversation, house made beers and solid drinks. We believe a bar is what its patrons and community make it, which is why we serve true, locally sourced foods when possible, well-crafted brews, and drinks to please all.

The Benson Brewery is a pub for all times. From its reclaimed wooden flooring, to its warm interiors, modern brewery, and exposed brick walls – Benson Brewery is a place without pretense. Our food, our drinks, our service and our space are inspired by old and new American traditions. We welcome all to come and feel at home in our brewery, a Benson Local

name: Bentley Brewing Company
description:
Thank you for your interest in Bentley Brewing and the Dark Horse Tavern. This is a family owned pub and brew house located at 12 Crane Street in Southbridge, Ma. Our goal is to offer a warm and inviting atmosphere where you can savor our array of freshly brewed beer on tap. We also offer a fully stocked bar for those wishing a more exotic cocktail. To accompany these libations we have a delectable selection of pub fare for your enjoyment.

As we gear up for the Dark Horse Tavern's grand opening in mid-June, Bentley Brewing, along with the help of our expert brew master, Tim Daley, will begin production of our four signature beers on tap. In subsequent weeks, we will be expanding our offerings to include four additional beers, as well as two cask ales, which will complete our on-site brewing selection.

Located just off Main Street in Southbridge, we are within easy access to major routes I-84 and the Mass Pike. Parking for over 150 cars and handicapped accessible, we offer outside dining on our spacious patio overlooking the scenic Quinebaug River, multiple large flat screen televisions broadcasting the latest sporting events throughout the bar, gaming options that include championship dartboards and a pool table, and live entertainment on Saturday evenings. You can also look into our brewing area where all the magic happens and Tim would be happy to answer any and all questions and we welcome your suggestions for future offerings. We accept reservations to accommodate parties of 30-70 guests in our conference room that includes a private bar and optional catering.

We are confident that after experiencing our locally grown and freshly prepared food, our fantastic brew and the exceptional service of our dedicated staff, you will make Bentley Brewing and the Dark Horse Tavern your favorite destination spot. We look forward to welcoming you and your guests in person at our riverside location at 12 Crane Street.

name: Bessemer City Brewing
description: Bessemer City Brewing is located just 25 miles west of Charlotte on I85 near the base of Crowders Mountain in historic Bessemer City. The beer is currently brewed and served in the Whisky Mill Bar & Grill known locally for its excellent eats, rubs & sauces. BCB’s focus is to brew high quality craft beer in the style of beers from the United Kingdom & Ireland. We celebrate the pride of our city’s culture and history by naming our beers after original city founders, industries & landmarks.

name: Big Top Brewing Company
description:
Big Top Brewing Company is a Sarasota based production brewery. Proudly distributed by Coastal Beverage, Gold Coast Eagle Distributing, Great Bay Distributing, and Pepin Distributing Company.

Having lived here all our lives we know the history behind our beautiful town. Typically seen as a tourist destination for beaches, weather and art, Big Top plans to add world renown beer manufacture to those well deserved titles. We look forward to crafting the best beer, in the best town and showcasing it with the best artwork designed by Ringling School of Art and Design graduates.

name: Bigelow Brewing Company
description: Bigelow Brewing Company is a small family owned startup located in central Maine. In keeping with our new motto, "Out with the horses, in with the brew," our equine facility has recently been renovated into a 3bbl brewery which offers a tasting room for sampling and growler fills. Our current features are two superbly hand crafted ales, Lying Bastard Pale Ale and Dementia Dog Double IPA with additional brews in the works.

name: Bike Dog Brewing Company
description:
Bike Dog Brewing Company is co-founded by four Sacramentans with a love for bikes, dogs and craft beer. The brewers fell in love with the endless flavor profiles available through brewing and the delicate hop profiles only available in incredibly fresh beer and want to share that love with beer drinkers from all over the Sacramento area.

Bike Dog is West Sacramento’s first brewery and the only one in town with a tasting room. We operate a 3 barrel brewhouse (industry speak for really small) on site. Brewing small batches means the beer will always be amazingly fresh and allows for the flexibility to mix it up a little with new recipes getting brewed on a regular basis. Because it will be brewed in such small batches, much of the beer will be available only for purchase in the Bike Dog tasting room — allowing customers to see the beer go from grain to glass and hobnob with the brewers and allowing the brewers to personally nurture the local craft beer community.

name: Brewery Terra Firma
description:
Brewery Terra Firma is unique in its approach as a brewery and as an agricultural destination. Through the integration of sustainable production methods, environmentally conscious waste management and innovative water recycling/reclamation techniques, we hope to become a model for breweries and agricultural destinations throughout the nation.

The BrewhouseThe brew house is an engineered mix of new and old technologies and techniques. Whole ingredients are used with traditional brewing equipment which is controlled by state of the art systems that manage temperature throughout the brewing process. These same systems harvest waste BTU's, capturing the energy that would normally be lost and reusing it to preheat ingredients, maintain product temperatures, and even heat the taproom via an in-floor heating system. Waste materials such as process water and spent grain are also captured and stored for fertilization and irrigation of our crops.

The prep table in the brewery quite often looks like the prep area in a fine restaurant. Fresh herbs, fruits and vegetables are a common sight, along with an amazing array of spices, roots and even flowers. Whole foods, fresh frozen or dried are used, artificial flavorings, extracts and coloring agents are not. The beer is unfiltered, its clarity being attained by the addition of natural clarifying agents and allowing ample time for the beer to condition.

Brewery Terra Firma began brewing operations in May of 2013, with the taproom opening to the public in July of the same year.

name: Buoy Beer Company
description:
Buoy Beer Company - Astoria, Oregon...Here, one of the West’s most relentless rivers meets the wilderness of an entire ocean. The unstoppable meets the unyielding. And here, a community with grit and backbone make that meeting work.

The river that built a town is home for building this beer. A place where hard work and hustle matter; where the local color has seen a little weather; where the newest generation wasn't born yesterday.

This is beer with history to it; a story to unfold, a tale to be told. Brewed from this confluence of pride and place. New beer, with a few centuries under its belt. Beer you can savor and share. Made of a few pure ingredients and a whole lot of local flavor.

Just like the town it comes from.

name: Burdick Brewery
description:
We are a company dedicated to creating great beer and hosting a creative space for others. We welcome all to come in and work with us.

Burdick boasts a great and customizable room perfect for private parties and corporate meetings/events. We are equipped with a projector and 120" screen ready to incorporate everything from video playback to PowerPoint presentations, or any other form of media your company may require. Contact us at burdickbrewing@gmail.com to get for more information and a quote today.

name: Burial Beer Co.
description: Burial Beer Co meticulously crafts ales and lagers from their Asheville brewery. We specialize in Belgian ales and German lagers, while also making American IPAs and Stouts. Come visit our small brewery on Asheville's South Slope and try some of our workings. Our production farmhouse brewery is in plans for 2014.

name: Burn 'Em Brewing LLC
description: Comforting the disturbed, and disturbing the comfortable. Creative, passionate, new brewery distributing in the northwest Indiana and Indianapolis areas.

name: Busted Sandal Brewing Company
description:
Busted Sandal Brewing Company is founded on the idea with the thought in mind that a great beer can be hand-crafted with locally sourced seasonal ingredients where possible and brewed in a facility that is energy efficient and powered solely by renewable energy sources. Tapping our combined 27 years of brewing experience, our members pledge to deliver not only beers that are bold and unique in character and offer frequent seasonal offerings that keep beer connoisseurs craving the next batch, but also easy-drinking session beers to be enjoyed by all.

We pride ourselves in the betterment of the craft beer industry as a whole and pledge to work together with, not compete with other local craft breweries. We want help to foster a community of craft beer creativity and excitement in the communities we deliver our beer to.

name: C'ville-ian Brewing Company
description: Coming soon! Charlottesville's smallest brewery! CBC is a place where you can relax with a book, or work on that homework you've been procrastinating, with a cold glass of beer. Nightly events will have you stopping in to see what's happening at the CBC. We will have tap rotations with customer input, so you will have a direct contribution to what beers you'll see on the tap! But be warned, we're looking to go bold, while using local and fresh ingredients! So come on down, have a seat, and enjoy a local brew!

name: Cannonball Creek Brewing Company
description:
Cannonball Creek Brewing Company was founded in January of 2013 by Jason Stengl and Brian Hutchinson.  Jason and Brian met in 2004 at the Mountain Sun family of breweries in Boulder, Colorado were they both learned to hone the craft they love.  With over 15 years of combined professional brewing experience and an uncanny ability to tolerate one another, they decided it was time to take a leap and chase the dream of opening their own brewery.

With both Jason and Brian calling Golden, Colorado home, the choice for a location was obvious.  After settling on a property on the north side of town, they wanted the brewery name to reflect the home town they loved.  After doing some research they learned that the original name for the majestic Clear Creek that runs through the center of Golden was Cannonball Creek.  The historical significance paired with the duo’s love for the iconic Cannonball made the decision a no-brainer and Cannonball Creek Brewing Company was born.

Knowing that they wouldn’t be able to do it all on their own, Jason and Brian called upon former co-worker and professional brewer Jonathan Lee to help run the tasting room and work in the brewery.  Jonathan’s experience as a craft beer bar manager, combined with his professional brewing experience made him the perfect fit.

name: Canyon Creek Brewing
description: Canyon Creek Brewing is Billings, Montana's first built-from-the-ground-up brewery and tap room.

name: Cartel Brewery
description:
There’s no intrinsic value in the adjective micro, so we’re not waving it proudly, like a flag. But that’s a good place to start: Cartel is a micro-brewery.

Woo-hoo.

To interpret: a small group of us are trying to master the craft of brewing beer and, right now, we’re doing it in a microscopic fashion. And we can’t say we dislike it that way.

We’re not caught up in dollars and tradition. We’re just trying to create tasty beverages for those few who will drink them.

name: Cartel Brewing Company
description:
Cartel Brewing Company is a small, passionate, and unique brewery that believes everything around the beer is just as important as as what's in the beer. 

We want you and the community to be more involved with the beer that you drink and think you should have a say in that.

name: Catawba Island Brewing Company
description: Catawba Island Brewing Company is a small production brewery in Northern Ohio brought to you by the Roder family who are 4th and 5th generation Catawba Islanders.

locations.name: Main Brewery

name: Cellar Brewing Company
description: We're a microbrewery that does more than just serve fantastic beer, we're also a small winery, and artisan distillery. So, if you would like a refreshing beer, relaxing glass of wine, or great mixed drink give Cellar Brewing Company a try.

name: Cellarmaker Brewing Company
description:
Cellarmaker Brewing Company has been in the works for quite some time. Look for our beers to start making their way around better known beer bars and beer focused restaurants in San Francisco starting in September. 

We have a tasting room in the same building as the brewery and will offer tasters, pints, and growlers. Some beers may be bottled further down the line but for now it's all draft. The only way you can take our beer away is in the form of a growler - which by the way, is a great way to drink beer! 

Look for a focus of plenty of hoppy beers, belgian-style saisons, dark beers, and sour beers. We are huge fans of wine and bourbon barrel aged beers as well so it's only natural for us to have a barrel program. Think bourbon barrels loaded with big chewy imperial stouts, excessively hopped IPAs, fruited sour beers, and funky saisons. This is what we love. This is what we are all about. We hope you are too!

Please follow along for the ride as we build San Francisco's next great brewery.

Cheers!

name: Cinder Block Brewery
description:
When we brewed our first batch of beer we never imagined where it would take us. The passion that was created for brewing these unique full flavored beers became intoxicating to all of us. This dream has been 3 years in the making and took a bit of luck and a lot of hard work.

It’s hard to believe we started small at our homes and have now grown into our 15bbl facility with a full taproom and barrel aging program. We haven’t forgotten our roots as we continue to focus on unique full flavored beers with plenty of character and a whole lot of attitude. We strive to share a truly unique experience in every glass of Cinder Block Beer.

name: Cobra Brewing Company
description: We know how satisfying it is to enjoy a nice hand crafted beer, that is why at Cobra Brewing Company we brew with only top quality ingredients. All of our crafted beer is brewed locally in Flower Mound, TX.

name: Collective Arts Brewing
description:
Collective Arts is a grassroots beer company built on the creativity inherent in both the craft beer and the arts communities. By fusing distinctly crafted beer with inspired art and artists we aspire to raise the creative consciousness through the sociability of beer. 

Collective Arts is made up with a team of creative junkies all brought together through our common love of well crafted beer. Our beers will be developed and continually re-imagined in collaboration with emerging brewmasters, artists, filmmakers, musicians and visionaries. 

Collective Arts first brew, Rhyme & Reason Extra Pale Ale launches in Toronto and throughout the Province of Ontario on September 9, 2013.

name: Colorado Plus
description: The 1st brew pub in the history of Wheat Ridge, CO.

name: Conyngham Brewing Company
description: Currently a local microbrewery. In the near future an onpremise tavern will be opening up as well.

name: Coppertail Brewing Co
description: Coppertail Brewing Co is a production brewery and taproom in progress scheduled to open in Tampa in late 2013. It was started by local home brewers and craft beer enthusiasts, Kent Bailey and Robb Larson. Brewmaster is Casey Hughes.

name: Council Brewing Company
description:
Council Brewing Company, established in 2013 and opened in 2014, is a small batch brewery, located in the Kearny Mesa area of San Diego. 

Our tasting room has been deliberately crafted to create a destination for people from all walks of life to come together, converse, and fellowship over truly fine craft beer. The name "Council" was chosen because it conveys this sense of community; a place where peers come together to deliberate, debate, and make decisions. The tasting room has a warm, inviting feeling, with green, tan, and rustic red toned walls, soft brown flooring and rich Mahogany bar tops. Careful thought was placed into the low music sound levels and decision to not install televisions in order to promote conversations. 

We place a tremendous emphasis on creating exemplary beer, crafted to the highest standards. We brew beers that are unique and extremely flavorful, focusing on Ales hailing from American, Belgian, and English origins. No matter what the style, we focus on creating intense aromas and flavors that are very well balanced and drinkable. Click over to "Our Beer" to find out more about our beer offerings.

Council Brewing Company is owned and operated by Curtis & Liz Chism and you can usually find them at the tasting room serving up freshly crafted beer.

name: Crank Arm Brewing Company
description: Welcome to Crank Arm Brewing! We are a craft brewery with tasting room located in the heart of the warehouse district in downtown Raleigh, North Carolina. Our mission is to provide fresh artisan beer while utilizing green transportation methods.

name: D9 Brewing Company
description:
Proudly serving Fanatical Ales in North Carolina since 2013.

D9 Brewing Company is a craft microbrewery located in North Carolina with the purpose of brewing and sharing outstanding beer that unites people. First envisioned in July 2009 over a pot of boiling wort, the founders believe every person, and beer, has a story and decided to start a brewery where both could be shared.

Our goal is to always keep our community (that's you) as our central ingredient (In a 'sit back, relax and have a beer' kind of way, not the creepy 'To Serve Man' way)!

D9's name is derived from the 9th Congressional District of North Carolina as a nod to the roots that we've grown by both living and working in the Charlotte area over the past decade.

name: Day Block Brewing
description: Day Block Brewing is a brewery-restaurant located in Downtown Minneapolis, Minnesota.  Their local beers are brewed in house using 100 percent locally sourced hops.  From IPAs to lagers and more, Day Block has a variety of unique brews to satisfy many tastes.

name: Defiance Brewing Company

name: Denizens Brewing Co
description: Denizens Brewing Co. is a craft brewery serving European-style lagers, American-style ales, Belgian-inspired beers, sour beers, and barrel-aged beers to both the craft beer aficionado and those new to high quality brews. We are located steps from the Metro in downtown Silver Spring and are opening in Summer 2014.

name: Door County Brewing Co.
description:
Door County Brewing Company is inspired by our surrounding; our friends, our families, our landscape. Our mission is to create beers that lead to a gathering of community and friends where ever you are. We promise to create only the best tasting, thought provoking, carefully sourced, eco conscience beers that are constantly pushing the edge of imagination and senses.

What you will find in our beers is music, food, friends, family, travel, trees, soils and flowers—not just ingredients.

name: Drekker Brewing Company

name: Eagle Creek Brewing Company
description: Eagle Creek Brewing Company is the first production brewery in Statesboro, GA. You can visit us @ eaglecreekbrewingco.com

name: Eastwood Brewing Company
description:
Eastwood Brewing Company, formerly Double Barrel Brewing Company, is a family owned nano brewery located in the Eastwood neighborhood of Syracuse, New York. Using a one barrel brew system, owner Pete Kirkgasser is able to create a unique variety of specialized craft brews. Pete's beers are only available locally at the Eastwood Brewing Company location. Customers are able to visit our tasting room and purchase beer in growlers seven days a week.

With a $3 tasting fee, patrons will receive 8 samples of fresh, craft beer. Growler fill prices vary depending on style and growler size. 64 or 32 ounce growlers, pint glasses and other merchandise is available also.

Cheers, and thanks for the support!

name: Ecliptic Brewing
description:
Over the coming months, John’s new space on N. Cook St. near Fremont and Mississippi will be transformed into John’s vision of a destination restaurant and brewery. His goal is to push the limits of creativity in the brewhouse, and create a sense of place in both the restaurant and the beer he builds. 

John’s background is one steeped in Oregon’s rich history in craft brewing. He spent his first two years, from 1986-1988, as a brewer at McMenamins’ breweries; his next four were at Deschutes, where he created the recipes for Mirror Pond, Black Butte Porter and Obsidian Stout; and John spent the next 20 years of his illustrious career as a brewmaster at Full Sail. He is now starting the next chapter with the creation of Ecliptic Brewing.

name: Edge Brewing
description: Edge Brewing is an American craft brewery located in the industrious Poble Nou district of Barcelona. Join our email list at www.edgebrewing.com to be notified of upcoming parties, tasting sessions, collaboration brewing schedules, brewery tours and a host of other surprise events.

name: Edmund's Oast
description:
Why Edmund's Oast?

The “Edmund” in the name comes from Edmund Egan, who began producing beer in Charleston after emigrating from England in the 1760s. "Oast” is a kiln used in the drying of hops. 

Edmund's Oast!

name: Ei8ht Ball Brewing
description:
Ei8ht Ball, named after the streets we got our
credit from, we are humble yet proud. Local but not
influenced. We might not move mountains, but we will
push the envelope. We will test theories and create
moments through our liquid in which tones and times
are our muse. We will brew and flow with poise and
confidence. We will rush for no one, yet hesitate for
nothing. We strive to please but make no apologies. No
billboards, neon lights and flashy text, it’s not our speed.
Make us part of your flight or enjoy us with a meal and
the mission is complete. For all of those in search of
something diverse, unique, improved and fresh, look
into, behind, under and around the Ei8ht Ball. What you
will find is what you never thought you were looking for.
This is Ei8ht Ball Brewing, the proof is the glass.

name: Eight Bridges Brewing
description: Production microbrewery and taproom

name: Empirical Brewery
description: Empirical Brewery is a startup brewery in Chicago Illinois.  Our mission is to create high quality craft beers that exceed your expectations.  We are focused on innovation and exploration of unique flavor profiles.  Our customers come first and have a direct impact on brewery operations.  The advantage of a craft brewery is that it can respond to changing market tastes.  To that end, we will endeavor to gather feedback from you and incorporate it into our brewing.  For updates on the brewery, follow us on Twitter, Facebook or our blog. Look for our beer to be available early next year.

name: ENKI Brewing
description: ENKI Brewing is the 20+ year culmination of the friendship between two beer lovers. John Hayes and Dan Norton met working for NIKE in the early-80s. Training and competing in track and road running events brought them together. They soon found another shared interest--experiencing the world of beer. The two made many friends spending spare evenings in New England pubs offering European beers, which, before the emergence of American craft beers, were the best beers available. The two often discussed their dream of opening their own brewery over the years. In August of 2012, John and Dan decided to take the keg into their own hands, and ENKI Brewing Company was born. Just a few months later, their dreams came to fruition at 7929 Victoria Drive. ENKI’s mission is to “Make the World a Friendlier Place – Two Beers at a Time” just as John and Dan have been enjoying and sharing beers with old and new friends, alike.

name: Factotum Brewhouse
description:
Mission Statement: Factotum Brewhouse assists homebrewers in creating a highly-drinkable product by providing professional brewing equipment, guidance and education, and a beer-loving community defined by mutual support, unbiased opinion, and a philosophy that anybody can brew.

Who we are: We are a sibling-owned brewhouse in the Sunnyside neighborhood of Denver. Our German-American upbringing has instilled in us a passion for beer and our background as professional educators compels us to impart our brewing knowledge to the community.

The brewhouse: Factotum Brewhouse is a brewery for the people, by the people. The drinks you enjoy in our taproom were conceived and created by homebrewers and other beer lovers under the tutelage of our head brewer in an effort to guide and teach our customers in the art of making great beer. Drink a beer, make a beer—at Factotum Brewhouse, the choice is yours. 

Twitter: @FactotumBrew 
4735 Lipan Street, Denver, Colorado 80211

name: Fair State Brewing Cooperative
description:
Fair State Brewing Cooperative will brew beer with a focus on quality, community, and cooperation.

Our cooperative will focus on sustainable business practices that empower employees as part of the broader brewing community to produce the finest beer without compromise.

name: Farnam House Brewing Company
description: Farnam House Brewing Company is an exciting new brewpub located in Midtown Omaha at 3562 Farnam St. Farnam House specializes in farmhouse ales and barrel aged beers and offers a diverse food menu made with locally-sourced ingredients and beer-infused creations.

name: Farnham Ale & Lager
description: Farnham Ale & Lager is a microbrewery in Farnham,  Québec with four primary beers identified by their bitterness level.

name: Findlay Brewing Company
description: We are a Nano Brewery in Findlay Ohio, and feature a variety of rotating beers. There are several locations you can find on tap us in the Findlay community to enjoy our beer, and you can also come to our taproom. We will be open every Friday from 5 pm to 10 pm. Our taproom is where you will be able to try several different beers that you won’t find anywhere else. So stop on by and let us know what you think!

name: Flytrap Brewing
description:
At Flytrap Brewing, we are dedicated to brewing high quality, hand crafted ales. Our equipment is designed to brew small batches, allowing us to ensure your glass is full of the freshest beer every time. Our goal is to consistently offer a wide range of flavorful, balanced beers in our tap-room. 

From day one, The Flytrap has been created as a community centered business with a neighborhood feel. This makes the Brooklyn Arts District the perfect home for our brewery and tap-room. Along with hand crafting tasty, small batch beers, we strive to positively influence our community and Wilmington’s craft beer scene. 

Our Brewery is named for the Venus flytrap, a carnivorous plant whose only native habitat in the world is within a 60 mile radius of Wilmington, NC. We are proud to call this our home town and to be associated with such a unique and impressive member of our environment. 

Our equipment is on order and we are beginning construction soon. We look forward to seeing you at The Flytrap!

name: Fonta Flora Brewery
description: Fonta Flora Brewery integrates the soul of agriculture with the artisanship of zymurgy to create a menagerie of rustic and savory libations. With an emphasis on seasonal flora, Fonta Flora brings English tradition and Belgian inspiration to the Appalachian mountains of North Carolina. Fonta Flora utilizes local artists to help conceptualize the notion that fermentation is yet another medium for creating art. This uniquely artisan approach to beer yields a sustainable product filled with culture from our very own community.

name: Forbidden Root Brewing
description: Forbidden Root is introducing a new line of craft botanical beer using natural ingredients including herbs, spices, barks, roots, honeys, stems, seeds, nuts, vanilla bean and cacao beans. We brew our beers in Chicago, IL with all natural ingredients and inspiration from early American brewing – when native plants and botanicals were a natural part of the rich, delicious beers of that forgotten era.

name: Fort Myers Brewing Company
description: Lee County's first microbrewery. Award winning craft ales brewed 7 barrels at a time.

name: Fort Point Beer Company
description:
Fort Point Beer Company is a New American brewery - the product of a thriving American craft beer culture, shaped by deeply San Franciscan values: quality craftsmanship and a spirit of innovation. We create balanced, thoughtful beers that reference traditional styles but are by no means bound to them. For us, brewing is the confluence of creative expression and refined technique. We want our beers to tell a story, inspire an idea, and be thoroughly enjoyable.

Fort Point Beer Company was founded in 2014 by brothers Tyler and Justin Catalana in the Presidio of San Francisco. The brewery resides in an historic Presidio building that was formerly used as an Army motor pool. Being situated in this iconic landscape reinforces our pride in San Francisco and in the beer we brew. Head Brewer Mike Schnebeck has developed a deft and impassioned brewing style over the past years at Mill Valley Beerworks and leads the pioneering spirit of our beers.

name: Fox & Crow Brewery
description: While Fox & Crow Brewery started out as a home brewery in Wilmington, NC, the head brewer and founder, Chip Bulla, actually began dreaming of turning what began as a hobby into a profession back in 2002. It was at that point he brewed his first extract batch and from then on he was hooked. After a few years, like many other home brewers, he moved into all-grain brewing and never looked back. Since then, he has been dedicated to perfecting both his craft and the quality of his beers. Now armed with an arsenal of hand-crafted recipes, he and his two partners, Andy Kerkhoff and Ashby Armistead, have decided to venture into the commercial arena and turn the dream that began in 2002 into a reality. In 2014, Fox & Crow Brewery will begin its journey and we invite you to like our page, share with your friends, and follow us on our path as we strive to share our passion for beer and brewing with a larger audience. Cheers!

name: Framingham Beer Works
description: Framingham Beer Works has a minimum of 15 in-house brewed beers on tap at all times, and a food menu featuring freshly prepared American foods including pub classics and unique specialties.

name: Freewheel Brewing Company
description: English-style cask conditioned session ales brewed on site. Our taproom is comfortable & eclectic—part brewery, pub, and beer garden.

name: From The Barrel Brewing Company
description: From The Barrel is a nano brewery in Londonderry New Hampshire. Located right off exit 4 on I93, we brew small batches of extremely fresh craft beer. We have a tasting room where you can view the brewery while enjoying samples. We also offer 32oz growler fills and 22oz bomber bottles at the brewery. Our tap list is ever rotating and offers a variety of hop forward brews plus a solid selection for the non-hop heads as well.

name: Funky Bow Brewery and Beer Company
description: We are a small 6.5 BBL brewery specializing in beer!

name: Garden Grove Brewing Company
description: Garden Grove Brewing Company is a new Nano-Brewery located in the heart of Chesterfield, VA. We are two local Virginia Commonwealth University Alumni/beer enthusiasts who were laid off from our corporate America jobs. So we asked ourselves, what is the next logical step for the rest of our lives? The answer of course-open a brewery! We plan on opening our doors April/May 2014. **Spoiler alert**-along with our other beers, we will always offer a tasty craft gluten-free beer on tap. Get ready Chesterfield/Richmond!

name: GBrewhouse
description: Local Micro Brew on the Outer Banks of North Carolina.

name: Gizmo Brew Works
description: Deep in the Umstead Industrial Park, something stirs. Amid the clank of modern machinery, a group of workers busy themselves with one of the world's oldest crafts: brewing. At Gizmo Brew Works, this meeting of contemporary technology and ancient know-how produces a tempting slate of small-batch beers. Inside tanks that hold the equivalent of 1,000 pints each, brewers prep favorites including the smooth and sweet Black Stiletto Stout and the complex Palisade Wasp India Pale Ale with the same care that has earned many of their past beers medals at the Carolina Championship of Beer. They also save room for seasonals, carefully adding a sweet caramel flavor and spicy Noble hops to their altbier. These beers and more make frequent appearances in the brewery's taproom, gracing pint glasses for impromptu toasts or filling up growlers for at-home sips. Never ones to shy away from curious guests, brewers also open up their facility for Saturday tours, walking groups through the beer-making process during 30-minute explorations.

name: Glass Bottom Brewery
description:
Our 1-acre hop farm is visible on route 41 just north of Great Barrington. We produce our own hops, and we are committed to living locally and sustainably. 

We brew unique artisanal ales, but more than that, we brew beer that tells a story. The point of each brew is to express an idea, to create an experience for the taster that shares the brewer's vision.

name: Grain Station Brew Works
description:
Grain Station Brew Works is Oregon's FIRST Community Supported Brewery (CSB). Located in Beautiful and Historic McMinnville, Oregon, the center point of Oregon wine country where we enjoy superb local cuisine and word class wine.

We are proud to be located in a community that supports local business and agriculture. With several CSA's (Community Supported Agriculture) already calling the area home, our CSB will give it's members a sense of pride and ownership in being part of a locally focused business that they can enjoy.

Many craft breweries have started in recent years with brewers experimenting in their garage. What makes GSBW special is that we bring over 24 years of professional brewing experience to a small, warm and inviting local community.

We're not wealthy individuals laying down large amounts of cash to build an empire. We're two local Oregonians with backgrounds in brewing and agriculture, combining with a goal to create the Best Beer Experience in the region!

name: Granite Falls Brewing Company
description:
Granite Falls Brewing Company is proud to be located in the historic Granite Bottling Works (1903-1978) and Pepsi-Cola Bottling (1978-2012) plant. The original 1903 Bolick’s bottling plant still stands as and within the brick walls along the left side of the building and lobby interior. Come celebrate with us 110 years of beverage production and bottling onsite! 

History: in December 2012, Mastroeli-MacNeil Equity Investments financed the purchase of this 31,690 square foot configuration of two warehouses, situated on 2.08 acres contiguous to Downtown Granite Falls. A panoramic view of the Blue Ridge Mountains runs the rear of the building. The owners financed a painstaking build-out, and are proud of the adaptive reuse of this warehouse/manufacturing space into a supper club, eatery, and old-style "watering hole." 

The Brewery: GFB is a 30BBL/(40BBL) craft beer production facility. We brew onsite and within sight while you indulge your senses in our Southern Gastropub restaurant and attached Tasting Room. Our brewpub features a wraparound 103-foot-long tasting counter, copper/penny-topped wine bar, and serves as a world-class music venue. Eclectic artifacts dress the spaces for those with an itch for the odd or unique.

The owners of Granite Falls Brewing Company invite you to visit our site, indulge in an experience that is In A Glass By Itself, partake of laughter, fellowship and community, lo and behold what we unearthed between the walls and specimens of the original Granite Bottling Works bottles. Become a part of Our History!

name: Gravel Bottom Brewery
description: Once upon a beer consumed, the idea of opening Gravel Bottom was born. We have crossed the country with stacks of recipes kept in journals, sketched business plans on scrap paper, and enjoyed our evolving product along the way. We have landed in the great town of Ada and hope to meet you soon.

name: Green Bench Brewing Co.
description: In the early 1900's St. Petersburg was known as "the Green Bench City". At their height some 2,500 benches lined the downtown sidewalks inviting passers-by to slow their pace and make friends of strangers. In the same way Green Bench beer will serve as a catalyst for community and cheer. People will gather around a pint (or two) to share in both good times and bad, to discuss business or tell a joke, to reminisce about life or dream about the future, to get up and dance to the music or to just sit back, relax, and enjoy the brew.

name: Green Door Brewing Company
description: Green Door Brewing is a nano-brewery based in Attleboro MA. We specialize in pre-prohibition American style ales & lagers, and other eclectic zymurgic stylings.

name: Green Lion Brewing Company
description:
What is Green Lion Brewing Company?

GLBC is the manifestation of twelve combined years of experimentation in fermentation. More than this it is the product of passion and drive to improve community resilience, bolster local agriculture, and support local businesses. 

Through our journey into brewing and fermentation we have discovered a world of endless possibility with beer. The spectrum of beers available today are just a fraction of a taste of what's possible. Beer has been around for thousands of years and with this come thousands of recipes, tales of yore, ancient forgotten knowledge, and a myriad of spices, herbs, and unique brewing styles that have been enjoyed throughout the ages. One of our goals is to rediscover these long forgotten recipes and styles and modernize them for today.

Our passion for knowledge and drive for quality keep us enthralled with the world of fermentation. It is our pleasure to craft quality beer not only for the palate but also to create beer for the mind.

name: Green Room Burgers & Beer
description: People around here love a local, handcrafted beer, and that is what we aim to provide. Bringing you the freshest local ingredients we can get our hands on, we strive for flavor and good prices.

name: Griess Family Brews
description: Griess Family Brews is a micro brewery located in Grants Pass, Oregon. They have just recently opened a taproom, Griess Family Brews & Taproom located at 220 SW H Street, Grants Pass, Oregon.

name: Griffin Claw Brewing Company
description: Griffin Claw Brewing Company is a Michigan based Microbrewery focusing on top quality beer production using state-of-the-art equipment and technology. The first brewery to commision a Muera Micro Mash Filter to test the extreme efficiency and flexibility of the cutting edge technology already offered at Macro scales.

name: Grist Brewing Company
description:
Grist Brewing Company is located just south of C-470 and Santa Fe Boulevard across the street from Shea Stadium.

Our focus is simply to make ales and lagers that are of the highest quality, approachable, and true to style. We certainly will experiment, it’s in our nature. However, the primary focus at Grist will be to make consistently great beers to be enjoyed year round.  We balance creativity with science to make great beers.

While striving to make exceptional beer is our passion, we are equally committed to making a positive impact in our community. Rather than saving a couple dollars, Grist made a significant investment in our economy by purchasing a new, American made 20 barrel brewhouse. We feel it’s important to support the community and economy that is going to support us.

name: Grist House Brewing
description:
Pittsburgh's newest microbrewery and tap house will be opening in late 2013 and is located in Millvale, just 5 minutes from downtown.  

Grist House Brewing features high quality, "salt of the earth", American and English style ales.  Our passion for the art of brewing comes through in our beers and we hope you enjoy drinking them as much as we enjoy brewing them.

Grist House Brewing: Grinding Out Great Beers!

name: Groundswell Brewing Company
description:
So here’s what you need to know. We are brewers and culinarians.

We want our beer to taste good, but we also want it to taste good with food. We don’t want to blow-out your palate, we want you to explore the hidden flavors and understand the complexities of the taste.

We love beer. We want you to love beer.

We will focus on crafting beers between 4.5% and 7.0% ABV. Our goal is a well-balanced, well-crafted, session beer. We’ll do the hop-thing too, but always with an exciting and culinary-focused angle.

Here’s the other thing. We’re adventurous. San Diego is the brew capital of the world (are we exaggerating here… NO!) There’s lots of great brewers. We found a few of them and held them down, twisted their arm really hard and asked them to brew something new and out there for us. Then, we found a few chefs who thought brewing was good sport. We helped them with the technical stuff and set them loose with the brew equipment.

You’ll see their brew in our taproom…they may have other gigs in the city, and we support their efforts there too. Beer is beer. Drink it here. Drink it there. Drink it anywhere (with apologies to Dr. Seuss).

name: Hailstorm Brewing Co.
description: Hailstorm Brewing Co. is a brewery located in Tinley Park, IL. Our brewery will feature a variety of ales and barrel-aged beers.

name: HammerHeart Brewing Company
description: HammerHeart Brewing Company is a new brewery in Lino Lakes, Minnesota that opened to the public on August 2nd 2013. Our brewery is built in the honor and recognition of the old Nordic and Celtic cultures, rich with experience and wisdom, literature, and life. HammerHeart represents who we are today because of who came before us.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Wednesdays, Thursdays, Fridays, and Saturdays from 2-10pm.

name: Happy Valley Brewing Company
description: A brewery and restaurant located in a restored wood-beamed structure in State College, Pennsylvania, the home of Penn State University.

name: Hard Knocks Brewing
description: Life is hard. At the end of a tough day, there's nothing quite like that first taste of cold craft beer hitting your throat. We're brewing for you.

name: Headlands Brewing Company
description:
Headlands Brewing Co. was founded by people that play outside.
We have a sense of adventure and embody the spirit of the place that we live, celebrating the bay, the history, the trails and the mountains that surround us. Outside the brewery you can find us surfing and swimming in the beautiful waters in our backyard or cycling or running through the valleys, parks, hills and mountains surrounding our bay. 

Patrick Horn (formerly of Pacific Brewing Laboratory) and Phil Cutti (Southpaw BBQ) create classic beers along with seasonal and experimental brews that push the envelope.

name: Henneberg Brewing Co.
description: We are a real Farm Brewery. We grow hops, we also grow and malt our own barley. Stop by our tasting room for samples of our great beers!

name: Heritage Brewing
description: Founded in 2013, Heritage Brewing Co. is a 20-barrel brewery set in the heart of Manassas, Virginia. Heritage Brewing is excited to bring great fresh and unique craft beer to our fellow Americans. From our 20-barrel brew house and oak aging program, to our 1/2 barrel artisan batches, we look to only produce the finest beer. We can't wait to share our passion for great beer with America.

name: Hi-Wire Brewing
description:
At Hi-Wire, we really want to embrace our craft and be as independent and authentic as possible, while also managing to maintain an approachability to our product, as we feature highly drinkable, hand-crafted brews.

We’re fortunate to be able to be a part of one of the Craft Capitals of the country. Located in Asheville's "Brewery District", Hi-Wire's brewery and tasting room are within walking distance of six other local breweries in a few block radius. Come visit us in June, 2013.

name: Highway 1 Brewing Company
description: A unique brewpub located on California's beautiful Highway 1, with ocean views from the bar and dinning room. Specializing in local ingredients and unusual combinations, in a relaxed coastal atmosphere.

name: Historic Brewing Company
description: Historic Brewing Co. is a Flagstaff, AZ based brewery. We believe in making damn good craft beer and bringing the local community together. As a family company established in 2013, Historic Brewing Company is proud to brew in the woods of Flagstaff and celebrate craft beer with local ingredients and a kickass attitude. We are a company rooted in passion, quality brewing methods, and good ol' fashioned hustle.

name: Hoots Roller Bar & Beer Company
description: Let it be known that the HOOTS BEER CO. is a mysterious brotherhood which concocts blue collar brews of unmatched character. Combining beer’s old world elements with fair dosages of dark secrets, imagination, and old fashioned rock and roll, H.B.C. are boundless in ambition and highly attuned to Winston-Salem’s industrious spirit and local community. The faceless and nameless conjurers of HOOTS are hellbent on fulfilling one age-old prophecy: You will enjoy the beer you were born to imbibe.

name: Hop Alley Brew Pub
description: Georgia's newest Brew Pub. Providing Alpharetta, Ga and surrounding communities with excellent beer, brewed in-house, served right off the tank, along with pouring beers, brought in from world renowned breweries. All while serving fresh, delicious, food provided by local farmers.

name: House of Pendragon Brewing Company
description:
House of Pendragon Brewing Co. focuses on handcrafted artisan made ales and lager.

Nothing is off limits at House of Pendragon Brewing Company. Here, we embrace the flavor. We use modern brewing techniques and the latest ingredients. With no restrictions holding us back, we’re not just thinking outside the box, we’re breaking it down and recycling it!

What does Pendragon mean? 
Pendragon is the last name of the famed Arthur Pendragon, otherwise known as King Arthur and The Knight’s of the Round Table. The translation of the name Pendragon literally means "head dragon" or "chief dragon".

name: Hunter's Brewing
description:
Hunter's Brewing is a nanobrewery located in Chesterton, IN. Brewed by hand on our one-barrel system, Hunter's Brewing beers focus on flavor and range from the traditional to the creative.

Owner-brewers Justin Reisetter and Amy Gentry take a thoughtful approach to brewing and are delighted to bring high-quality, small-batch boutique brews to the Duneland region.  

We offer 32 oz half-growlers to go.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Thursday 5-9pm, Friday 4-9pm, Saturday noon-9pm and most (not all) Sundays 1-6pm.

name: Huss Brewing Company
description:
We are a Quality Lager and Aleworks Brewery with focus on American Craft Beer.  We are located in the now defunct Rio Salado Brewery in South Tempe.  We have a Tap Room with 20 revolving handles of the beers made on site along with the best beers available in Arizona.

Two people with a lot of passion for Craft Beer.  Owned and operated by husband and wife team Jeff and Leah Huss.  Together they have 20 years experience in the Craft Beer Industry.  Jeff “Ginger” Huss graduated from the Siebel Institute of Brewing Technology and was the Head Brewer for BJ’s Brewery in Chandler Arizona for over Seven years.  Leah Huss graduated from Scottsdale Culinary Institute with a degree in Culinary Arts and has been the Managing Partner at the Papago Brewing Co. in Scottsdale since 2001.  Both share a love and passion for American Craft beer and it’s culture, and look forward to sharing their knowledge and experience with you!

name: Idyll Hounds Brewing Company
description: Idyll Hounds is a small craft brewery located in northwest florida. The white sand beaches forever blue sky and warm waters of florida give inspiration to the carefully crafted fresh tasty brews. Whether it's the tropical crispness of the Divide N Conch'r DIPA, the refreshing beachablility of our Man O' Wheat or the unique flavors of our seasonal line you can know our beer is responsibly brewed with the freshest and finest ingredients. At Idyll Hounds we brew for the beer enthusiasts and the novice beer drinkers alike. With a local first mind set concoctions are brewed with poetic attention to detail and memories that easily inspire lines of prose.

name: Imperial Oak Brewing
description: Imperial Oak Brewing is a Micro brewery focused on brewing high gravity beers with many barrel and wood aged offerings. We'll have some incredible session-able beer in there somewhere too.

name: Indiana City
description: It’s our mission to brew innovative beers for craft beer lovers in Indy. And that is that. We’re focused on Indy. We’re doing all we can to add to the beer culture right here. We’re filling growlers at our taproom near downtown, and we’re on tap at select craft beer bars in Indy.

name: Institution Ale Company
description: We are a family owned and operated micro-brewery dedicated to crafting uncompromised and unfiltered American style ales. We are committed to producing and serving world class beer to our local community. Our Camarillo based brewery has an on-site tasting room and our beer is available at select local bars/restaurants.

name: Intangible Ales
description:
Brewer of eclectic, rustic and wild ales based in South Central Pennsylvania.
Intangible Ales is a new project combining Terry Hawbaker's passion for brewing and Kristen Mullen's passion for photography (Watch for Kristen’s cool label art!)  Most releases will be in bottles, however there will be some occasional draft as well. 

Style is subjective. Art is an ale.

name: Jagged Mountain Brewery
description: Jagged Mountain Craft Brewery is a unique, innovative, and distinctive brewery based out of Denver, Colorado.

name: Jailbreak Brewing Company
description: We are a production craft brewery located in Laurel Maryland. In addition to serving our beers to hundreds of restaurants, bars and retailers across the state, we also operate a tap room with a capacity of 150ppl. We offer 8-12 different styles of beer for purchase by the pint, sample flight and growlers to go. Food trucks are present onsite during normal business hours.

name: Joyride Brewing Company
description: A craft brewery across the street from the banks of Sloan's Lake in Edgewater, Colorado. Hop On!

name: Kaktus Brewing Company
description:
This is a nano-brewery 
​​Producing 500 barrels yearly 
With 6-to-8 beers on tap

We shipped in German Made equipment to set ourselves apart in the local industry allowing us to specialize in lighter style lager beers while keeping the favorites such as Porter's, ESB's, IPA's and other classic Ales.  
​​
​O​ur reverse osmosis water purifier allows us to control the quality of water during each and every brew. ​​​
​
​Mike Waddy, our brew master, has over years of experience creating beer recipes and hand crafting beers consumed by many New Mexican beer enthusiasts.

name: Kansas City Bier Company
description: Authentic German-style lagers and ales available in local taverns, restaurants, and the brewery tasting room.

name: Kauai Beer Company
description:
The Kauai Beer Company will be a neighborhood microbrewery producing small quantities of high-quality beer for sale to individuals and local restaurants. Our beer will be available in our tasting room, as well as for sale to-go in durable, refillable growlers (large stainless-steel bottles with resealable tops). 

Our ultimate goal is to open a full time, restaurant in front of the brewery that creates simple, high-flavor dishes that everyone will enjoy. Foods that go great with beer, and beer that goes great with our food.

Please visit our website www.kauaibeer.com 
Or follow us on http://instagram.com/kauaibeer and https://twitter.com/KauaiBeer

name: Kaweah Brewing Co.
description: Kaweah brewing Co. is a small scale hand crafted brewery! Every batch is made with finest ingredients available!

name: Kelsen Brewing Company
description: Kelsen Brewing company is a new nano brewery in Southern New Hampshire creating craft beers full of flavor and pushing the limits of style.  We have a 3BBL brewing system and we have an onsite tasting room where you can purchase bottles and growler fills.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: We will have a tasting room that will be open Thursday, Friday and Saturday.  Exact hours are to be determined.

name: King Harbor Brewing Company
description:
We brew classic styles with a California coastal twist by sourcing unique ingredients to emphasize flavor profiles and the drinking experience - hoppy pale ales that use subtle fruit additions to brighten hop character, an American style brown ale blended with a cold press coffee, and a Saison brewed with locally sourced lemon verbena and lemon peel.  

And when we are not brewing we can usually be found on the beach, at Dodgers or Kings game, or shooting birdies on the links.  For us, an awesome beer is part of an awesome experience.

name: La Quinta Brewing Co.
description: Located in the Greater Palm Springs area, La Quinta Brewing Co. opened it's doors in 2013 and is served in over 100 bars/restaurants throughout the desert.

name: Left Field Brewery
description:
Know that feeling you get on opening day, after a walk-off home run or a suspenseful no-hitter? That’s exactly how we feel about beer.

We started Left Field Brewery under a simple philosophy: that great beer is about great taste and good times. We’re not here to confuse you with jargon or gimmicky promises - we’re here to make distinct, flavourful beers that can stand on taste alone. We’re brewing the kind of beer that we like to drink, inspired by the sport we love to play and watch; the kind of beer you can sit and enjoy during the game while talking shop over a blown call or a spectacular play. 

Left Field Brewery aims to make beers you’ll remember. We’re free agent brewers who started out in the minors as a hobby home-brewery. We’re currently contract brewing with a game plan to build a microbrewery in Toronto to call home.

name: Living The Dream Brewing Co.
description:
We are a Denver area small batch craft brewery creating unique beer recipes available at our brewery & taproom in Littleton, Colorado.

Six beers brewed year long to quench your thirst during any activity. From a vigorous game of badminton to an afternoon of rev-ing your 2-stroke noise maker at a Nascar race, we've got ya covered.

name: Lonesome Valley Brewing
description: Lonesome Valley Brewing began as a dream of high quality craft brews, and a place where neighbors can get together and enjoy life in the heart of Prescott Valley. LVB is committed to serving the local community, and we want the  local guest to know that as soon as they hear our name. Our slogan embodies our mission, "Our Beer is Our Bond." We plan to keep the distance between  the brewer and the guest as small as possible to stay responsive to the changing needs and tastes of our community.

name: Lost Nation Brewing
description: We are located at 254 Wilkins St (Just off Route 100) in Morrisville, VT. Slightly off the beaten path, we are proud to offer some of the most finely crafted beers in the great state of Vermont. Pair any of our fine selections with any of the house made, locally sourced items off of our delicious menu and we have no doubt that you will leave satisfied!

name: Lowercase Brewing
description:
We’re a beer company.
We got our start in Seattle making stuff in our basement and seeing what our friends thought of it. After a little trial and a lot of error, the beer started to taste pretty good.

name: Lynnwood Brewing Concern
description:
You can call Lynnwood Grill "comfortable excitement.” It’s the kind of place where people know your name... and the bartenders know what you're drinking.

Now located across from the Raleigh Grande Theatre, this locally owned bar and grill is the perfect place to grab a bite before or after the movie. It’s also a cozy place to meet friends for drinks, watch a game, or listen to live music. When the weather is nice, enjoy drinking and dining on the outdoor patio or the spacious rooftop.

name: LyonSmith Brewing Co.
description: LyonSmith Brewing Co. operates in the amazing town of Penn Yan, NY. Our mission is to make beer that is worth drinking, a company that is worth working for, and a community that is worth living in.

name: Mad Bomber Brewing Company
description:
We are a craft brewery in Hayden, Idaho. Follow us for updates and promotions for our fall opening!!!

Inspired and financed by United States Army Explosive Ordnance Disposal Technicians (Bomb Squad), the Mad Bomber Brewing Company will offer a solid lineup of assertive American Ales.

name: MadTree Brewing Company
description:
MadTree Brewing Company was started by three self-proclaimed “maniac” homebrewers and aspiring entrepreneurs who believe strongly in the creation of beers that stand up to the best craft brews across the country.
Along with that vision they put their own “mad twists” on their creations. The MadTree approach is simple – create high quality beer, educate the consumer, run a responsible business, and support the local communities.
MadTree engages local artists and craftspeople for their marketing materials, can designs, tap handles and furniture. Many of these efforts have received local and national recognition.

HIGHLIGHTS
- The trio quit their corporate jobs in 2012/2013 and in January 2013 they brewed their first commercial batch.
- In April they opened their taproom and became the first modern craft brewery to can their beer in the state of Ohio.
- Draft Magazine rated PsycHOPathy IPA a 97/100, the second best score for an IPA reviewed by Draft Magazine.
- PsycHOPathy IPA was named as one of the “Six New Craft Can Designs That Belong in an Art Gallery” by craftcans.com

name: Martin City Brewing Company
description: Martin City Brewing Company is Kansas City’s newest family owned restaurant and pub.  It sits nestled in Martin City, near the train tracks.  Martin City Brewing Company has a one of a kind food menu with top-notch chefs on staff.  There are over 50 different brews to choose from.  Not only will one find a cozy space inside the pub, but one can enjoy the beer garden and live music on any given weekend night.  With chain restaurants taking over the American landscape, this restaurant/tavern is a great escape from “the norm.”  The newly remodeled hundred-year-old building is far from your ordinary place next door.  Make Martin City Brewing Company your next night out and your neighborhood hotspot!!

name: Mazama Brewing Company
description: We are a brewery in Corvallis, OR. We specialize in Belgian style beers made with the best ingredients the Northwest has to offer.

name: Meridian Hive Meadery
description: Artisan crafted honey wines in Austin, Texas. Filling your glass with history in the New World.

name: MIA Brewing Co.
description: M.I.A. is a production brewery in South Florida. We are inspired by our tropical environment and culture. We are dedicated to the production of the finest hand-crafted beer. Our brands will be available at local bars and restaurants this Fall.

name: Middleton Brewing
description: Middleton Brewing is a small 1.5 barrel brew pub, located in south Everett.  It started as a hombrewers dream and through blood, sweat, and a lot of hard work and determination, was made a reality, by the Middleton family, in 2013.  Geoff Middleton, head brewer and owner, began creating his own ales in college and instantly fell in love with the brewing process and craft brew industry.  Middleton Brewing is family operated business, focusing community support, doing things right and supporting what we believe in.

name: Mill Whistle Brewing
description: Mill Whistle Brewing is a one barrel brewery focused on exceptional craft beers despite our lack of sophistication. Mill Whistle Brewing is on the site of the 100 year old Safrit Lumber Mill. While this mill closed in the 70s the lumber yard next door is a viable operation. We have obtained the lovely steam whistle that announced lunch time in Beaufort every day for 100 years. Therefore, the brewery is named after this whistle. The brewery will be returning to the noon day whistle tradition.

name: Miner Brewing Company
description:
Located in the heart of the Black Hills, and owned and operated by the same family behind the award-winning Prairie Berry Winery, Miner Brewing Company produces craft beers that are both traditional in nature, and yet truly “South Dakota”.

With five generations of family lineage handcrafting beverages in South Dakota, and with 15 years as winemaker and owner of Prairie Berry Winery, Brewmaster Sandi Vojta is inspired by the traditional brewing styles of her family’s European heritage. By infusing regional and seasonal ingredients into the recipes handed down to her, she has skillfully adapted those traditional styles to create craft beers with a regional character, setting each distinctly apart from other microbrews.

All of our beers are produced in small, 15-barrel fermenters, allowing us to keep each batch small enough to maintain microbrew quality and a close attention to detail at all times. The results are craft beers that are approachable and distinctive, to be enjoyed by craft beer novices and enthusiasts alike.

We invite you to experience Miner Brewing for yourself, as we open our Tap Room in Hill City this fall 2013. Stop on by for a flight or a glass, hang out to enjoy our seasonal selections, and stay a while for a little South Dakota hospitality. 

Join us in the Black Hills and discover your own pint of gold.
